posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: We’re putting together a robot for our offseason match, but upon initial tests the krakens seem to shake violently and noisily even when we gave it less voltage and used an empty java program. All our krakens behave this way but our falcons do just fine. Does anyone have similar issues? Can anyone help us out here?

posts.name: Leo
posts.cooked: Can you please share the code you are running, along with any videos of the kraken shaking?

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked: I have sometimes mistakenly assumed that weird behavior was due to a software issue, when the actual cause was a loose screw.  Not saying that’s your problem now, but it’s worth checking.

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked:
Have you tried spinning them with Phoenix Tuner individually? I would try use the Voltage Out mode in Phoenix Tuner to see if they spin normally. Then switch to Velocity mode. If the acts weird, then it is likely a PID issue.

I would also try to factory reset them in Phoenix Tuner.

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
Leo
posts.cooked: Did you test the motors individually before putting them in the swerve modules?

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: We didn’t. However, we are testing them one by one now. The old Krakens are still shaking violently inside the modules. A new Kraken we tried outside the modules didn’t have the same problem though. All these krakens came from the same batch and are all brand new.

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: Thanks for your suggestion. However, we don’t have a PID now. We are using an empty program (which I have uploaded to this reply section). Spinning them with Phoenix tuner individually yields the same result. However, we tried connecting another kraken in outside the frame and it worked just fine. All these krakens came from the same batch and are all brand new. We are now taking a kraken away from the swerve module to try it outside the frame to see if the problem is the module or not.

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: Update! Factory reset WORKED! thank you!

posts.name: Jasmine Xu
posts.cooked: Update! We fixed it by factory resetting the krakens! Thank you everyone!

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked:
Glad factory reset worked. I would note that a lot of the control requests (like VelocityVoltage) uses PID internally. You will need to config the PID in Phoenix Tuner or in the code. If you choose to use control requests.

Configs can be viewed, modified, backed-up, restored, and factory-defaulted via the Configs tab in Phoenix Tuner X. Tuner X configs page To apply a modified config, press the apply button (download...

(From CTRE Example project)

Seems like you are trying to produce the swerve code from Phoenix Tuner. The project should automatically config all the drive/turn motors correctly. Good luck

posts.name: Andrew Lawrence
posts.cooked: Make sure you’re running the latest firmware. Some of the early firmware releases had some issues here and there, but the latest firmware seems to be pretty robust.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
